 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָפַת‎</span>] **verb** ==twist, turn, grasp with a twisting motion== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***twist, wring***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***lapâtu***</u></abbr>, ***overthrow***, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 382</sup>); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּלְפֹּת‎</span> [[Judg.16.29|Judg 16:29]] followed by accusative, Samson ***grasped*** the two middle columns. **Niph\`al** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּלָּפֵת‎</span> [[Ruth.3.8|Ruth 3:8]] the man started up ***and twisted himself***; 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלָּֽפְתוּ‎</span> [[Job.6.18|Job 6:18]] the paths of their way [i.e. of the streams] ***turn aside (twist, wind***, with lessening force), so [[BDB#AV|AV]] [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Da|Da]] [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] &gt; [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Ol|Ol]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Siegf|Siegf]] [[BDB#Du|Du]], who read Qal <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְפְּתוּ‎</span> or Pi\`el <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְלַפְּתוּ‎</span>, making <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ארחות‎</span>, = ***caravans***, subject 

<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֵץ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָצוֺן‎</span> see below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ליץ‎</span>.
